q: The way the natural world works is presented by __________.
In the levels of biological organization, a __________ is a lower level than a tissue.
A(n) __________ is composed of multiple organs working together.
Multiple organisms of the same species in an area form a __________.
Different populations interacting in an area form a __________.
The highest level of biological organization is the __________.
The process by which plants convert light energy into chemical energy is called __________.
The process by which organisms break down glucose to release energy is called __________.
The continuous movement of water within the Earth and atmosphere is known as the __________ cycle.
The biogeochemical cycle that describes the movement of oxygen through the biosphere is called the __________ cycle.
The __________ cycle describes the movement of carbon through the Earth's systems.
The process by which nitrogen is converted into different chemical forms as it circulates among the atmosphere, terrestrial, and marine ecosystems is known as the __________ cycle.
The biogeochemical cycle that describes the movement of phosphorus through the biosphere is called the __________ cycle.
In the water cycle, water vapor in the atmosphere condenses to form __________ and precipitation.
__________ is the process by which water changes from a liquid to a gas in the water cycle.
In the nitrogen cycle, nitrogen fixation converts atmospheric nitrogen into __________ that can be used by plants.
__________ bacteria play a crucial role in the nitrogen cycle by converting atmospheric nitrogen into a usable form.
In the carbon cycle, plants absorb carbon dioxide from the atmosphere through the process of __________.
The burning of fossil fuels releases __________ into the atmosphere, contributing to the carbon cycle and climate change.
In the phosphorus cycle, phosphorus is primarily stored in __________ and sedimentary rocks.
The main reactants in photosynthesis are carbon dioxide, water, and __________.
The main products of photosynthesis are glucose and __________.
In cellular respiration, glucose is broken down in the presence of __________ to produce energy, carbon dioxide, and water.
